definitions.definition: To grow aged; to become old or older; to show marks of age.
examples: He grew fat as he aged .

subdefinitions.definition: To suffer the passage of time so as to later be viewed or turn out in a certain way.
examples: His prediction that we didn't stand a chance hasn't aged well, now that we've won the cup.
The sitcom was made in the 1970s and its casual sexism has not aged well.
subdefinitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a statement, prediction, etc.

definitions.definition: To cause to grow old; to impart the characteristics of age to.

examples: We age the whiskey for five years.

subdefinitions.definition: To treat or tamper with in order to give a false appearance of age.
examples: This clock is modern, but it has been deliberately aged in an attempt to make it seem antique.

definitions.definition: To determine the age of (the length of time that something has been alive or in existence).
examples: There are several ways to age trees.

definitions.definition: To indicate or reveal that (a person) has been alive for a certain period of time, especially a long one.
examples: I clearly remember hearing the news of Kennedy's assassination. That ages me.

definitions.definition: To allow (something) to persist by postponing an action that would extinguish it, as a debt.
examples: Money's a little tight right now. Let's age our bills for a week or so.
One his first assignments was to age the accounts receivable.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To grow aged; to become old or older; to show marks of age.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to grow old; to impart the characteristics of age to.
( transitive ) To determine the age of (the length of time that something has been alive or in existence).
( transitive ) To indicate or reveal that (a person) has been alive for a certain period of time, especially a long one.
( transitive , figuratively ) To allow (something) to persist by postponing an action that would extinguish it, as a debt.
( transitive , accounting ) To categorize by age.
